metadata.description: Major transmission lines across all Canadian provinces - 735kV, 500kV, 345kV, 230kV corridors and HVDC ties
metadata.coverage: All Canadian provinces - Hydro-Quebec 735kV network, Ontario 500kV backbone, BC Interior-Coast, Alberta 500kV, Manitoba HVDC Bipoles, cross-border US ties
metadata.notes: Comprehensive Canadian transmission corridors including James Bay 735kV lines, Churchill Falls export, Ontario nuclear evacuation circuits, Manitoba HVDC Bipoles I/II/III, BC Peace-Vancouver transmission, Alberta 500kV backbone, and all major Canada-US interconnections

branches.name: Des Cantons - Sandy Pond (HVDC Phase II)
branches.notes: Quebec-New England HVDC tie - Phase II, connects to Sandy Pond in Massachusetts

branches.name: Churchill Falls - Montagnais (735kV)
branches.notes: Main export line from Churchill Falls to Quebec grid

branches.name: Muskrat Falls - Soldiers Pond (LIL HVDC)
branches.notes: Labrador-Island Link - undersea HVDC cable to Newfoundland

branches.name: Soldiers Pond - Woodbine (Maritime Link HVDC)
branches.notes: Maritime Link - undersea HVDC cable connecting NL and NS

branches.name: Eel River - Quebec (HVDC Back-to-Back)
branches.notes: Back-to-back HVDC converter for asynchronous tie to Quebec

branches.name: Henday - Riel (Bipole III HVDC)
branches.notes: Bipole III HVDC - commissioned 2018, western route for reliability

branches.name: Gretna - US Border (500kV)
branches.notes: US tie to MISO (Great River Energy)

branches.name: Custer (BC) - Ingledow (500kV)
branches.notes: Main cross-border tie to BPA - West of Cascades

branches.name: Chissibi - Albanel (735kV Circuit 2)
branches.notes: James Bay main evacuation corridor - second circuit

branches.name: Site C - Peace Canyon (500kV)
branches.notes: Site C connection to Peace system

branches.name: Sir Adam Beck 1 - Sir Adam Beck 2 (345kV)
St. Lawrence - Quebec Border (230kV)
branches.notes: ON-QC interconnection near St. Lawrence River
